headline: Mushroom Pork Chops
description: Seasoned pork chops with cream of mushroom soup, chopped onions, and fresh mushrooms. A family-favorite recipe that's delicious and easy to make.

video.description: See how to make a simple but scrumptious one-pan pork chop meal.
video.name: Mushroom Pork Chops

name: Mushroom Pork Chops
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 pinch garlic salt, or to taste
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Season pork chops with salt, pepper, and garlic salt.
Brown chops over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet. Add mushrooms and onion and saut√© for one minute.
Pour soup over chops. Cover, reduce the heat to medium-low, and simmer until chops are cooked through, 20 to 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Quick, easy and delicious, had to add about 1/2 can of water so the chops could simmer.

Made this tonight for my brother and I . Good overall. Was out of Cream of Mushroom soup, so I substituted Cream of Celery, which worked out fine. I thought the gravy might be too thick so I added 3/4 of a can of whole milk mixed with a bit of Heavy Whipping Cream . I also added just a few drops of Kitchen Bouquet Browning Sauce for color mostly. Served it with Wild Rice and a Stoufer Spinach Souffle. I will make it again.

Too bland for me. I make mine without onions, fry the mushrooms adding cayenne pepper and salt then quick fried well seasoned pork loin chops with lots of black pepper and a bit more cayenne and salt rubbed in, then throw the mushrooms back in ,add the mushroom soup and mix well. I find the cayenne and black pepper take the whiteness away from the soup. Then serve the works over nice egg noodles to sop up the gravy.

It's a good start. I did not use cream of mushroom. I used 1, 13.5 oz can of coconut milk. I added a small tsp. Of lemon grass paste. Worcestershire sauce to taste, for me about 5 tablespoons. I used yellow sweet onion and regular white mushrooms bc it's what I had. Would rather portobello. I added baby spinach at the end. I served over a white, brown, wild, and red rice mixture.

This was ok. I didn't think the cream of mushroom tasted very good as a sauce base. It definitely needs to be thinned. The taste is overwhelmingly mushroom-y without this. It could be great with these changes.

I would just add some more seasonings and maybe some crisp bacon, apples or whatever else you like. More herbs always welcome. I would cook it in a crockpot or in the oven until fall apart tender. Serve over rice and have broccoli or any veggies you like with pork. You could even add some dry onion soup to the mushroom soup or change the soup to celery or asparagus. The concept is great!
My family loved it and request it occasionally, but the recipe was not my favorite. I often find that the porkchops become tough.

Very good and quick. Used 2 large boneless pork chops and sliced down the middle. All other things the same. My husband really liked it also so this will be a staple in my cooking.

Awesome! So easy and quick. I used a full pound of cremini mushrooms and 2 cans of soup. Served with baked potato and I steamed asparagus on the pork chop mixture for the last 10 min or so of cooking time. It'll be a new fave!

I saut√©ed the onion, then added mushrooms and sauteed for about 5 mins, then tossed in 2 cloves of fresh minced garlic and sauteed for a couple minutes more. I then added 2 cans of regular cream of mushoom soup and 1/2 cup of half & half along with a few sprigs of fresh Rosemary and Thyme, stirred well and then poured over the chops. I covered the pan with heavy duty aluminum foil and cooked on the stovetop on med/low for 30 minutes. The meat was so tender and flavorful! Will definately make this again! We loved it! This recipe is not like it shows in the video. The recipe is missing 2 ingredients. To brown the chops and saut√© the vegetables you need oil which is not listed in the ingredients. The Onions are listed as chop not sliced like the video shows. The soup of mushroom is very thick and without some liquid it would not create the sauce as you see in the video unless you use the amount of oil and grease that seems to have been use in the video. I used small amount of olive oil to brown the chops, removed them after browning both sides, added a few pumps of OO to saut√© the mushrooms and chopped onions. put the chops back in after a few minutes and added the can of the condensed mushroom soup with half can of water (can use broth instead but I was not prepared to make these changes so I use water.) Those changes created a creamy sauce to pour over the chops and the mashed potatoes. I gave a rate of 3 although the flavors were good, but the poorly written recipe made it a 3.

I take them out and cook the mushrooms, onion and some garlic a few minutes. If the pan is dry I add a little butter. I put the chops back in and add 2 cans of cream of mushroom. There was enough gravy that we could smother our mashed potatoes too. Simple to reheat on the stove as leftovers. We just covered the pan and put the heat on low. Give them a try!
